info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Alexander, Caldwell, southeastern Avery and northwestern Burke Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Lenoir to 7 miles southeast of Blowing Rock to 9 miles southeast of Newland. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Cedar Rock, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Grandfather Mountain State Park, Edgemont, Kings Creek, Globe, Collettsville and Patterson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
